info.name: NWCA Production API - Complete
info.description: Complete API collection for Northwest Custom Apparel. Auto-generated from Express routes.

item.name: üõçÔ∏è Product Search

url.raw:
{{baseUrl}}/api/featured-products?// Search query
      category=&// Filter by category (can be array)
      subcategory=&// Filter by subcategory (can be array)
      brand=&// Filter by brand (can be array)
      color=&// Filter by color (can be array)
      size=&// Filter by size (can be array)
      minPrice=&// Minimum price filter
      maxPrice=&// Maximum price filter
      status = 'Active'=&// Product status filter (default to Active)
      isTopSeller=&// Filter for top sellers only
      sort = 'name_asc'=&// Sort order (default to name ascending)
      page = 1=&// Page number (default: 1)
      limit = 24=&// Results per page (default: 24=&max: 100)
      includeFacets = false // Include aggregation counts=&refresh=

request.description: GET /api/products/new Returns products marked as new (IsNew=1) Supports filtering by category, brand, and limit Cached for 5 minutes to reduce API calls  Query params: - limit: Maximum number of results (default: 20, max: 100) - category: Filter by category name - brand: Filter by brand name

item.name: Create Admin Products Add Isnew Field

request.description: POST /api/admin/products/add-isnew-field Creates the IsNew boolean field in the products table This endpoint is idempotent - if field already exists, returns success

item.name: Create Admin Products Mark As New

request.description: POST /api/admin/products/mark-as-new Batch updates products to set IsNew=true based on style numbers  Request body: { "styles": ["EB120", "EB121", "EB122", ...] }  Response: { "success": true, "recordsAffected": 150, "styles": ["EB120", "EB121", ...], "styleCount": 15 }

POST /api/admin/products/clear-isnew Clear IsNew field from all products (set to false)  Purpose: Reset the IsNew field when too many products were incorrectly marked  Response: { success, message, recordsAffected }

item.name: Create Admin Products Add Istopseller Field

request.description: POST /api/admin/products/add-istopseller-field Creates the IsTopSeller field in the Sanmar product table  This is a one-time setup endpoint that creates a YES/NO (boolean) field. It's idempotent - safe to call multiple times.  Response: { success, message, fieldName, alreadyExists? }

item.name: Create Admin Products Mark As Topseller

request.description: POST /api/admin/products/clear-istopseller Clear IsTopSeller field from all products (set to false)  Purpose: Reset the IsTopSeller field when you want to start fresh  Response: { success, message }

GET /api/products/topsellers Returns products marked as IsTopSeller=true  Query parameters: - limit: Number of products to return (default: 20, max: 100) - category: Filter by category (e.g., "T-Shirts") - brand: Filter by brand name (e.g., "Port & Company")  Response includes parameter-aware caching (5-minute TTL)

item.description: Search and browse products with advanced filtering

request.description: POST /api/embroidery-costs - Create new embroidery cost record
Note: Use EmbroideryCostID (not PK_ID) from the record

request.description: POST /api/files/upload Upload a file directly to Caspio Files API Expects multipart/form-data with a 'file' field
GET /api/files/:externalKey Retrieve a file from Caspio by its ExternalKey
GET /api/files/:externalKey/info Get file metadata without downloading the file
DELETE /api/files/:externalKey Delete a file from Caspio
POST /api/files/upload Upload a file from base64 data to Caspio Files API Now uses shared upload service for consistency
GET /api/files/:externalKey Retrieve a file from Caspio by its ExternalKey
GET /api/files/:externalKey/info Get file metadata without downloading the file
DELETE /api/files/:externalKey Delete a file from Caspio
POST /api/quote-items-with-file Create a quote item with optional file upload If ImageUpload field contains base64 data, uploads file first
Optimized endpoint that combines product, pricing, and DTG data in a single request
GET /api/health - Health check endpoint with comprehensive info

item.name: Get Caspio Daily Sales By Rep

request.description: GET /api/caspio/daily-sales-by-rep Fetch archived daily sales by rep for a date range  Query params: - start: Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required - end: End date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required  Returns: { days: [{ date, reps: [...] }], summary: { reps: [...], totalRevenue, totalOrders } }

item.name: Get Caspio Daily Sales By Rep Ytd

request.description: GET /api/caspio/daily-sales-by-rep/ytd Get Year-to-Date summary aggregated by rep  Query params: - year: Year to calculate YTD for (default: current year)  Returns: { year, reps: [...], lastArchivedDate, totalRevenue, totalOrders }

item.name: Create Caspio Daily Sales By Rep

request.description: POST /api/caspio/daily-sales-by-rep Archive a single day's per-rep sales data to Caspio  Body: - date: The sales date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required - reps: Array of { name, revenue, orderCount } - required  Returns: { success: true, date, repsArchived, message }

GET /api/caspio/daily-sales Fetch archived daily sales records from Caspio  Query params: - start: Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required - end: End date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required  Returns: Array of { Date, Revenue, OrderCount, CapturedAt }

POST /api/caspio/daily-sales Archive a single day's sales data to Caspio  Body: - date: The sales date (YYYY-MM-DD) - required - revenue: Total invoiced revenue for that day - required - orderCount: Number of orders invoiced - required  Returns: { success: true, record: {...} }

GET /api/caspio/daily-sales/ytd Get Year-to-Date summary from archived data  Query params: - year: Year to calculate YTD for (default: current year)  Returns: { ytdRevenue, ytdOrders, daysWithData, lastArchivedDate }

POST /api/caspio/daily-sales/bulk Archive multiple days of sales data at once (for backfilling)  Body: Array of { date, revenue, orderCount }  Returns: { success: true, created: N, updated: M, errors: [] }
- refresh (optional): Set to "true" to bypass cache
GET /api/designs/store/:store_id - Get active designs for a specific store
GET /api/designs - Get all active designs grouped by StoreName (admin view)
PUT /api/designs/:pk_id - Update a design by PK_ID
DELETE /api/designs/:pk_id - Soft delete a design (set IsActive=false)

query.description: Filter records using SQL-like WHERE clause
Maximum number of records to return (1-1000)

request.description: GET /api/garment-tracker/:id - Get single record by ID_Garment
Body: { OrderNumber, DateInvoiced, RepName, CustomerName, CompanyName, PartNumber, StyleCategory, Quantity, BonusAmount, TrackedAt }

GET /api/gift-certificates  Query gift certificates with optional filters. When certificateNumber is provided, returns single certificate with resolved ShopWorks order IDs. Otherwise returns array of matching certificates.

GET /api/gift-certificates/by-order/:orderId  Reverse lookup: Find gift certificates used on a specific ShopWorks order. Takes ShopWorks order ID, finds external order ID, then searches gift certificate history.
DELETE /api/gift-certificates/clear  Delete ALL records from the Inksoft_Gift_Certificates table. WARNING: This is a destructive operation - use with caution!
POST /api/gift-certificates/bulk  Bulk insert gift certificate records. Caspio supports up to 1000 records per insert request.

GET /api/jds/products/:sku  Get details for a single product by SKU  URL Parameters: - sku: Product SKU (e.g., "LPB004")  Query Parameters: - refresh (boolean): Force cache refresh (default: false)  Response: { "result": {...product...}, "cached": false }  Returns 404 if product not found
Retrieve inventory with optional filtering and sorting

GET /api/jds/health  Health check endpoint for monitoring  Response: { "status": "healthy", "service": "JDS Industries API", "timestamp": "2025-11-06T10:30:00Z", "config": { "cacheEnabled": true, "cacheDuration": "1 hour", "rateLimit": "60 req/min" }, "endpoints": {...} }

GET /api/manageorders/orders/verify/:extOrderId  Verify that an order was received by ManageOrders  Parameters: extOrderId - External order ID (e.g., "NWCA-12345")  Response: { "success": true, "found": true, "extOrderId": "NWCA-12345", "uploadedAt": "2025-10-27", "orderData": {...} }
POST /api/manageorders/auth/test  Test authentication with ManageOrders PUSH API  Response: { "success": true, "message": "Authentication successful", "tokenExpires": "2025-10-27T11:30:00Z" }
GET /api/manageorders/push/health  Health check endpoint for PUSH API functionality
Retrieve pull with optional filtering and sorting
Retrieve verify with optional filtering and sorting

GET /api/manageorders/customers  Fetches unique customers from ManageOrders based on orders from the last 60 days.  Query Parameters: - refresh (boolean): Force refresh of cached data (default: false)  Response: { "customers": [...], "cached": true/false, "cacheDate": "2025-10-26", "count": 383 }
GET /api/manageorders/cache-info  Returns information about the current cache state (for debugging).

GET /api/manageorders/orders  Fetches orders by date range with multiple date filter options. Date filters: date_Ordered, date_Invoiced, date_RequestedToShip, date_Produced, date_Shipped Optional: id_Customer - Filter by specific customer ID (e.g., ?id_Customer=1821)
GET /api/manageorders/orders/:order_no  Fetches a specific order by order number.
GET /api/manageorders/getorderno/:ext_order_id  Gets the ManageOrders order number from an external order ID.
GET /api/manageorders/lineitems/:order_no  Fetches line items for a specific order.
GET /api/manageorders/payments  Fetches payments by date range.
GET /api/manageorders/payments/:order_no  Fetches payments for a specific order.
GET /api/manageorders/tracking  Fetches tracking information by date range.
GET /api/manageorders/tracking/:order_no  Fetches tracking information for a specific order.
GET /api/manageorders/inventory-cache-stats  Returns detailed statistics about the inventory cache (for debugging).
POST /api/manageorders/inventory-cache-clear  Clears the entire inventory cache (for debugging/troubleshooting).
GET /api/manageorders/inventorylevels  Fetches inventory levels with optional filters. Supports: PartNumber, ColorRange, Color, SKU, VendorName, etc.
GET /api/monograms - List all monograms with optional filters
GET /api/monograms/:orderNumber - Get single monogram by OrderNumber
POST /api/monograms - Create new monogram (with upsert support)
Retrieve pc54-inventory with optional filtering and sorting

item.name: Get Manageorders Pc54 Inventory Cache Stats

request.description: GET /api/manageorders/pc54-inventory/cache-stats  Debug endpoint to view cache statistics

item.name: Create Manageorders Pc54 Inventory Cache Clear

request.description: POST /api/manageorders/pc54-inventory/cache-clear  Clear the PC54 inventory cache
GET /api/manageorders/pc54-inventory/colors  Debug endpoint to view discovered colors and cache status
Supports prefixes like EMB, DTG, DTF, SPC for quote IDs (e.g., EMB-2026-001)

Primary mapping endpoint GET /api/sanmar-shopworks/mapping?styleNumber=PC61&color=Forest  Provides complete ShopWorks translation including: - SKU structure (which SKUs to create) - Size field mapping (which Size fields to populate) - Color translations (display name ‚Üí ShopWorks catalog name) - Pricing for each SKU
Helper endpoint: Get suffix mapping rules GET /api/sanmar-shopworks/suffix-mapping
Helper endpoint: Get color mapping for a style GET /api/sanmar-shopworks/color-mapping?styleNumber=PC61

ShopWorks import-ready format GET /api/sanmar-shopworks/import-format?styleNumber=PC850&color=Cardinal  Returns flat JSON array with one entry per SKU, ready for ShopWorks import Each entry includes all size fields with actual size values where enabled

item.name: Create Sanmar Shopworks Quote To Linesoe

request.description: Transform embroidery quote items to ShopWorks LinesOE format POST /api/sanmar-shopworks/quote-to-linesoe  Takes quote builder line items and transforms them into ShopWorks-ready format: - Standard sizes (S/M/L/XL) grouped into single line item - Each extended size (2XL, 3XL, etc.) becomes separate line item with suffix - Proper Size01-Size06 field population - Size limit flags set correctly
GET /api/taneisha-accounts - List all accounts with optional filters
GET /api/taneisha-accounts/:id - Get single account by ID_Customer
Optional query param: ?instock=true to return only in-stock colors
GET /api/thumbnails/by-design/:designId Look up a design thumbnail by Design ID
PUT /api/thumbnails/:thumbnailId/external-key Update the ExternalKey for a thumbnail record
GET /api/thumbnails/top-sellers Get thumbnails for top-selling designs
GET /api/thumbnails/sync-status Get sync status and statistics for the thumbnail table
POST /api/thumbnails/reconcile-files Reconcile files in Caspio Files "Artwork" folder with database records Matches files by parsing ThumbnailID from filename and updates ExternalKey/FileUrl
POST /api/thumbnails/backfill-fileurls One-time backfill: Populate FileUrl for records with ExternalKey but empty FileUrl
GET /api/thumbnails/uploaded-ids Get all ID_Serial values that already have images uploaded (ExternalKey populated) Returns ID, file size, and upload timestamp for change detection

POST /api/thumbnails/upload-with-stub Upload a thumbnail file and create/update a stub record Saves file size and upload timestamp for change detection  Expects multipart/form-data with: - file: The image file (filename format: {ID_Serial}_{description}.ext)
GET /api/thumbnails/stats-by-year Get thumbnail statistics broken down by year Shows total records and uploaded records per year based on timestamp_Added
GET /api/thumbnails/all-ids Get all ID_Serial values from the thumbnail database Used by sync scripts to pre-filter files before uploading
